summary.p: 84 fol.; Writing surface: parchment; Shelfmark: Y. 4565; Qurʾānic Text: Q 46:1-51:60; 5 lines per page; Dimensions: 146 x 195mm.

This entry is based on the catalogue of Fehmi E. Karatay (1888-1968). Currently we do not have access to the images. With exceptions, the catalogue does not contain precise information on the distribution of the text throughout the pages. For this reason, only fol. 1 is given.

Karatay (1962) describes the manuscripts as follows, p. 25: "73 Y. 4565. Kur’andan bir bölüm. Parşömen. 195mm boy ve 146mm eninde 84 yaprak. Sahifede 100mm uzunl.[uğunda] 5 satır. Tahminen IV. (X) asırda kopya edilmiştir. Baştan 2 ve sondan 2 zahriyer hendesi geçmeli, şekiller ve sure başlari, güller ve duraklar müzehheptir. Miklepli ve yazma tezhipli kırınızı deri cilt. Bu mushaf Aḥḳaf (46) suresini başından Z̠āriyāt (51) suresinin sonuna kadardır."

This can be translated as follows: "73 Y. 4565. A part of the Qurʾān. Parchment. 84 leaves of 195 mm height and 146 mm width. The text area [contains] 5 lines measuring 100 mm. Probably copied during the 4th (10th) century. The first and the last two zahriyes are illuminated with geometric interlaced patterns. Forms, the sūra beginnings, roses and verse separators are gilded. Red leather binding with flap (miklep) and gilded yazma. This part is from the beginning of Q 46 (Sūra al-Ahqāf) until the end of Q 51 (Sūra azl- Z̠āriyāt).”
